jparsec.astronomy

Class Astrometry

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.astronomy.Astrometry

  • public class Astrometry
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to process plate photographs/CCD images and perform astrometry. Based on the program appeared in Sky & Telescopy, July 1990, by Jordan D. Marche.

    It is recommended to use the position (1, 1) for the center of the first pixel when giving the location of the stars in the constructor. This (1, 1) is the first pixel for SExtractor, so the positions given by SExtractor can be used directly with no modification. With only the WCS instance you cannot know which is the first pixel in the image.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Astrometry

        public Astrometry(LocationElement loc0,
          double[] cte)
           throws JPARSECException
        Constructor for a previously computed plate solution. Information about residuals will not be available.
        Parameters:
        loc0 - The approximate apparent equatorial coordinates of the plate center, (X/2, Y/2) position, being X and Y the width and height in pixels.
        cte - The plate constants.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the invalid set of plate constants are invalid.

      • Astrometry

        public Astrometry(LocationElement loc0,
          double[] cte,
          double[] res)
           throws JPARSECException
        Constructor for a previously computed plate solution. Information about residuals are included in the constructor.
        Parameters:
        loc0 - The approximate apparent equatorial coordinates of the plate center, (X/2, Y/2) position, being X and Y the width and height in pixels.
        cte - The plate constants.
        res - The plate residuals in RA and DEC (2 values), in radians.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the invalid set of plate constants are invalid.

      • Astrometry

        public Astrometry(LocationElement loc0,
          LocationElement[] loc,
          java.awt.geom.Point2D[] p)
           throws JPARSECException
        Constructor for a given plate.
        Parameters:
        loc0 - The approximate apparent equatorial coordinates of the plate center, (X/2, Y/2) position, being X and Y the width and height in pixels.
        loc - The apparent equatorial coordinates of each reference star.
        p - The rectangular positions (x, y) in the plate for each reference star. The x position goes from 0 to X-1, and y from 0 to Y-1.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the number of reference stars is below 4.

    • Method Detail

      • getPlatePosition

        public LocationElement getPlatePosition(double X,
                               double Y)
        Returns the equatorial position on the plate for a given rectangular position. The x position goes from 0 to the size in pixels of the plate, and the same for y.
        Parameters:
        X - The x position.
        Y - The y position.
        Returns:
        The equatorial coordinates.

      • getPlatePosition

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D getPlatePosition(LocationElement loc)
        Returns the rectangular position on the plate for a given equatorial position.
        Parameters:
        loc - The equatorial position.
        Returns:
        The rectangular coordinates.

      • getPlatePositionResidual

        public double[] getPlatePositionResidual()
        Returns the residuals for a given position in the plate. Note these values are not dependent on the position on the plate, they are constants.
        Returns:
        The residuals for right ascension and declination, in radians.

      • getPlateConstants

        public double[] getPlateConstants()
        Returns the plate constants named A, B, C, D, E, and F.
        Returns:
        The plate constants.

      • getResiduals

        public double[] getResiduals()
        Returns the residuals for the input equatorial positions of the reference stars. You can use this data to see if a given reference star is producing erros in the determination of the plate constants, and delete that reference star if necessary.
        Returns:
        The residuals for right ascension and declination for all reference stars (radians). If you have 5 reference stars, this array will have 10 values: first 5 for the residuals in right ascension for each star, and another 5 for the corresponding residuals in declination.

      • getAsWCS

        public WCS getAsWCS(boolean distortion)
             throws JPARSECException
        Returns the solution of this plate as an WCS instance. Projection returned is TAN, and coordinates equatorial, for equinox and epoch 2000.
        Parameters:
        distortion - True to fit also the distortion CD polynomial.
        Returns:
        The WCS instance that fits this plate solution.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Test program.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
